channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wood barriers need removal, 15th November
item.description:
Wood and plastic barriers need removal ,serving no purpose at all ,cars keep hitting them as not visible at night ,and taking up parking ,which is becoming a py in the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22A,22B,22C,22D, Sholden Gardens, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Collapsing wall near public pavement - 13 Hartham road, 15th November
item.description:
The wall outside this property is ready to collapse and leaning out into the public pathway at a precarious angle. It needs to be made safe, a child was recently killed by a collapsing wall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartham Road, Holloway, London Borough of Islington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not table and chairs but mattresses, 14th November
item.description:
As you can see from the pictures the mattresses in the front garden of 479 Abbey Road have now been moved and dumped on the footpath outside a neighbouring property. Every time this property gets new tenants sadly the same thing happens .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, London Borough of Bexley

item.title: Near the pub, 14th November

item.title: Streetlights are not working properly, 14th November
item.description:
Streetlights are not working properly as they only switch on after 6pm, while the sun goes down at 4pm - pitch dark until 6, Very dangerous, as pavements aren't perfect, people can and do fall, and darkness attracts crime too. Attached image illustrates a large local area, dozen of streets are affected. This is an ongoing issue since the end of British Summer Time (26th Oct) , and reported as early as 29th October.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household renovations waste, 14th November
item.description:
Yet again people are dumping household renovations waste outside the penge east dry cleaners. It is becoming their favourite dumping spot and it's unsightly for those of us who live nearby and have to pass by every day. This waste has been there about 3 days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
